summary: The AWS Cloud Practitioner course provides foundational knowledge about AWS Cloud technologies. Participants will learn to define what the AWS Cloud is and understand its basic global infrastructure. The course covers AWS Cloud architectural principles, the value proposition of AWS Cloud, and key services on the AWS platform along with their common use cases, such as compute and analytics. It also addresses basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform, the shared security model, billing, account management, and pricing models. Additionally, participants will learn to identify sources of documentation or technical assistance and understand the core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud. The course spans 10 sessions, totaling 50 academic hours, and is offered in a hybrid format, allowing participants to choose between in-person classes at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or online via Zoom. The course is scheduled to start on 29.11.2024, with classes held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

COURSE NAME: AWS Cloud Practitioner

COURSE OVERVIEW: The AWS Cloud Practitioner course is designed to provide participants with foundational knowledge of AWS Cloud technologies. This course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. Participants will learn about AWS Cloud infrastructure, services, and operational principles, enabling them to understand and utilize AWS Cloud effectively.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Explain the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Discuss basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Define the billing, account management, and pricing models.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 29.11.2024.
- Duration: 10 sessions, totaling 50 academic hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participants' preference.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and register, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or via email at esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber, a division of Bar-Ilan University dedicated to specialized programs.

CERTIFICATIONS: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner (Foundational).
